Well, this is my favorite movie of all time, and the best movie I've ever seen. I'm kind of undecided on Tarantino's projects. I liked Kill Bill one and two, hated Pulp Fiction, hated Resovoir Dogs even worse. This movie did not use Tarantino's original ending. There is a lot of good info in the 2 disc director's cut. All I can say is if you've never seen this movie, you're cheating yourself. I've had people reluctant to watch it because it sounds like it's a "chick flick." It is anything but. It is a smart, action love story. A unique and one of a kind film. I promise this film will not leave you disappointed, but completely satisfied. Which is all a good movie can do. And when it comes to an all star cast! O M G! There will never be this many A list stars in a movie again. Some of the biggest only have cameos, which I love. (think Val Kilmer and Samuel Jackson.) Watch it as released then check out the alternate ending, I think you'll agree this movie was cast perfectly (like 8MM) written and directed perfectly, and even edited well. (think Indiana Jones or the original Star Wars trilogy editing) Every scene moves the story forward. I never felt like I was missing information or watching filler. I've gushed enough. I love it, you probably will too. Go watch it!

Review title: Go on take the money and run!
Review_body: Or shall I say contraband? Either way this high-voltage thriller will have you on the edge of your seat for 120 minutes. This script was anything but beginner's luck, Knoxville born Quentin Tarantino's first script geared for a major motion picture was in fact originally intended to be written and directed by Tarantino himself but due to the "business of Hollywood" he sold it and the direction went to the already veteran director Tony Scott. Nonetheless True Romance exemplifies the epitome of what 1990's action movies were all about, Adrenaline.With an all star cast and a lineup of amazing scenes this movie is packed with excitement from the very start. The monologues are captivating, the violence is bombarding, and the story itself is surprisingly charming. Christian Slater and Patricia Arquette deliver a dynamic lead portraying a love-struck fantasy for any couple wishing to keep their relationship on the outer realm of exciting, to say the least.The supporting cast is superb, consisting of many big names and faces that have rocked the silver screen for decades. The talent and delivery from this supporting crew can only be believed when experienced. From mobsters and police, hookers, and tough guys, movie producers and gangsters, stoners and pimps, even the humble voice of a musical legend, this eclectic mix of characters unravel the 1990's and opens the door to a wide array of critics leaving only one opinion that is truly relevant, yours.-Eric Douglas Statzer

Review title: Oh my gosh, the perfect film??
Review_body: Pulp Fiction remains my favourite film and is the bench mark that i judge all other films against ever but when you realise that the format for True Romance was the same and that it was Tony Scott who changed it to a linear format,then this could have been the perfect film. Having said that, it still remains one of the few films that i could watch at least once a week forever.Listening to QTs commentary on the 2 disc set, and the problems he had getting the film off the ground,it seems inconceivable that this film very nearly slipped away.Every time i watch this film, i always wish that i hadn't seen it and that this was the first time!! I rate it that highly.The razor sharp, snappy trademark QT dialogue, the music, the characters and the attention given to establish each one,the intricate build up to the final Mexican stand off,the music, even the ending(and here you have a choice!)Just reading the list of actors involved, Hopper,Jackson, Walken,Pitt, Kilmer, Slater,Arquette,(yeah, cistern lids don't break when you belt someone over the head with them! )Sizemore, Penn (sadly missed),etc says quality. And this,a first screen play?? A hidden gem, a cult movie?Shout it from the rooftops, this film is that good, and the whole world needs to know. It would be perfect if the deleted scenes could be inserted into their true position.This film never got the credit it deserved and still remains a classic amongst film goers who know their stuff. I only wish that this had been QTs first girlfriend,the one that he married!

True Romance is a all time classic film directed by Tony Scott, and written by Quentin Tarantino. Christian Slater gives the best performance of his career as Clarence Worley, and PATRICIA ARQUETTE is just as good as Alabama Worley. It also has a magnificent cast including, DENNIS HOPPER, VAL KILMER, GARY OLDMAN, BRAD PITT, CHRISTOPHER WALKEN, BRONSON PINCHOT, SAMUEL L. JACKSON, MICHAEL RAPAPORT, SAUL RUBINEK, TOM SIZEMORE and CHRIS PENN one of my favourite actors. This film has some amazing scenes and some fantastic dialogue which is what you would expect from a writer like Tarantino. The final shootout in the hotel is brilliantly done with plenty of suspense. You must see this film before you die, if you are someone who likes this kind of movie. 10/10.

Having watched True Romance, I have now seen every film that Quentin Tarantino has had a major involvement in (i.e the films he wrote and directed, not the ones he presented). It's fair to say that none of them have disappointed me - except Jackie Brown, but I'll moan about that if and when I review it- and True Romance is absolutely no exception!I loved this film, fair and square. But what's so intriguing about it is that it's unlike any of Tarantino's other films...maybe that's because he didn't direct, he only wrote it, and it is slightly lovy dovy - not something I would expect from Quentin! Most of the soundtrack is songs I would never really expect to hear in one of Q.T's flicks (espically the song that's played almost every time someone has an intimate conversation) and a lot of the cast I just would never expect to see in association with him. That may sound a little negative but come on, ask yourself, before you heard of this film, did you really expect to see Gary Oldman in a Tarantino movie...I don't think so! Having said this though, when you listen to some of the dialogue, you can instantly tell it's Q.T's words. I don't really know how to explain it but, you'll know what I mean. Oh and Samuel L. Jackson makes a short appearance too!One of the things that attracted me to this movie was the cast. Gary Oldman (one of my fav's), Brad Pitt, Val Kilmer, Christopher Walken and Dennis Hopper. I'll be honest, I have never seen a Christian Slater movie (other than Robin Hood, but I don't count that as a Slater movie) and I wasn't really all that fussed about seeing him, but I tell you, he just really sits right with Tarantino's screenplay. Of course, I don't really think he was the only actor that could have cast has "Clarence", but he shone none the less. Once more, I felt that he really made a proper connection with Patricia Arquette, or rather "Alabama" - the love interest. Christian and Patricia are the stars of the film and are in pretty much every scene, but all of the other big names get a maximum of 2 scenes - though I think Dennis Hopper had 3. This may come has a bit of a downer to those of you who are looking to see your favourite actor, but don't be disappointed - remember, Anthony Hopkins stole Silence of the Lambs and he was only in it for 15 minutes! Gary Oldman's performance was utterly staggering and slightly frightening; not only was he in a film I didn't him to be in, but he was also playing a role I could never have imagined him as. He plays...wait for it...a pimp who thinks he's black! Who'd of thought Commissioner Gordon could pull that off? The one scene that Christopher Walken is in, and I mean ONE, is one of my favourite parts of the film. Chris just reels you in when he says "I'm the Anti-Christ" in his very thick accent! Now, I really enjoy Val Kilmer's films (don't ever mention Batman Forever to me though, that film just makes me weep) and I was looking forward to him playing another one of these amazing cameos, but the credits rolled and I just couldn't for the life of me remember seeing him and I'm sure that those of you who watch this film, and don't watch Val on a loop, will feel the same way. I looked at his name in the credits and it says he plays a character called "Mentor" and I had no I idea who the hell he was. But, then it hit me, there are two scenes in the film where Clarence (Slater) is MENTORED by his hero, Elvis Presley, and when looked back at those scenes I thought that Elvis did sound quite a bit like Val's character in Tombstone. So now you know...and knowing is half the battle! Though his face is blurred, so you can't see his questioning face.The soundtrack is simple to judge, all of the songs that feature are stuck in my brain and...I like it!People who will like this: Tarantino fans, Oldman fans, Walken fans, Slater fans, Rom-Com fans, Gangster fansPeople who won't like this: Those who fancy Val Kilmer, those who didn't like Platoon due to it's over-repeated main theme

I love True Romance, loved it the first time, and still love it! Super fun, ultra-violent twist on classic love story. Extraordinary cast!!! The last really fantastic performance by Christian Slater, incredible improvised scene between Dennis Hopper and Christopher Walken, James Gandolfini doing what he did best years before The Sopranos, and a magnificent battle sequence between him and Patricia Arquette, who stands out as the all-too-rare STRONG female lead in a genre near entirely bereft of any, especially at the time. While Gary Oldman has a long list of outstanding performances--particularly as villains--from Leon the Professional to The 5th Element, I would argue that in his role in True Romance, more so than any other, he transforms himself into a character almost unrecognizable from either the other roles he's played, or himself as an actor. Even though he's got relatively little screen-time in this flick, he steals the show as one of the most memorable performances. Across the board this cast was, and remains, unmatched both in raw talent/skill and chemistry. Even with their tertiary roles, actors like Tom Sizemore and Brad Pitt bring a levity and realism to their characters in a movie that could have easily fallen into the annals of hyper-violent 90s pulp schlock. The few characters/performances worth criticizing, like that of Balki from Perfect Strangers, or the big blonde body guard at the end, are completely forgivable in the face of this film's casting powerhouse.Classic Story!!! Although the story is relatively simple, it carries all of the central components to a classic archetype: redemption, sacrifice, true love, and tragedy. The simplicity of the story overall might feel boring or unoriginal to some, but I believe it frees the characters to have clear drive and compelling motives. A story with greater complexity would easily crowd a movie like this one, which devotes as much depth as it does to so many different characters.Nerd Cred!!! The movie opens with a loner comic book and martial arts cinema fan falling in love with a beautiful, incredible woman that loves those same things (and long before it was cool to like comic books). Clarence then proceeds to become a total badass, mirroring the super heroes from comic books in his actions and accomplishments. The film does a great job of masking this in its raw and desperately raced tone, but the subtext remains as a nod to old school fanboys, if not a shout out.This film is certainly not for everyone. If you're looking for a story with unpredictable twists, unconventional editing, top production values, complex plot elements, intellectual concepts, and/or visionary scope, this movie might not be for you. These are all fair criticisms to level against True Romance, but it's definitely not trying to be or embody these elements. This is a character, scene, and situationally driven story, and at that, True Romance is stellar ;)
Only redeeming qualities for me were Walken and Slater's performances. Otherwise, a very messy story line with weak characters and plot. Tarantino's work is truly overrated.

Apart from being the breathtaking cinematic experience that it is, True Romance doubles as a masterclass in movie production by selecting the very finest ingredients: cracking script, mouthwatering acting talent and stylish director.Many have been quick to point out the Tarantino script and wealth of star actors but few have acknowledged the input of the film's director.  Being a fellow Brit, I can't help but feel proud to know that one of the finest thrillers of the decade was directed by Tony Scott.With this film, Scott proves he has the ability to handle wordplay as well as anyone.  If there was ever any doubt before, merely breathe in the chilling, claustrophobic atmosphere he crafted in the Hopper/Walken scene. Scott was also able to mold memorable character moments for all the other cameo players.  A feat all the more remarkable, considering the limited amount of screen time given to each actor.  Even the Tom Sizemore character lingers in the mind, despite the frantic editing each moment he's on screen.Unfortunately, I cannot acknowledge Tarantino (the director) with the same regard. His blistering screenplays all contain the trademark incisive repartee but Tarantino's directorial style caters too much to the scriptwriter.  Tarantino merely shoots the actors performing to dialogue (similar to that of a parent videotaping his child in a school play). Considering the excellence of his writing and the ability of each actor, this approach almost works but an experienced director is needed to sustain a visual momentum.  As a result of his one-dimensional approach, all three Tarantino films suffer from the occasional pocket of tedium. One example would be the Jack Rabbit Slim's scene in Pulp Fiction (an opinion also shared by the film's editor - Sally Menke). I even heard someone SNORING during my screening of Jackie Brown.  Tony Scott may have the reputation of favouring style over content, but once given a quality script, he has the ability to carry it with precision timing as well as flair which leaves you feeling like you've seen an electrifying movie as opposed to an electrifying play.This is not to disregard the fact that Tarantino has directed many classic movie moments but his forte remains behind the pen  not the megaphone.  It can be argued that out of all his screenplays, the two most entertaining movies were True Romance and From Dusk Til Dawn.  Neither of which were directed by Tarantino himself.  As True Romance has shown, once you have the very best players working in their respective fields, the result can be awesome.

This film starts quite promising, tails off a bit after 30 minutes, and the less is said about the gory final the better. Less blood and fewer killings wouldn't have done any harm to the story - or perhaps there wouldn't be much left of a story without all the violence.

Review title: What a cast, what a story, WHAT A MOVIE!!!!
Review_body: With a cast like Brad Pitt, Christopher Walken, Christian Slater, Patricia Arquette, Dennis Hopper, Val Kilmer, Samuel L. Jackson, Chris Penn, & Gary Oldman and with a writer like Quentin Tarantino, does anything more need to be said?  With this movie and these people, you can't go wrong!!!

It has a story that has romance, action, poetry, at times a bit quiet and at times a bit pulse - simply a picture of life from frame to frame. Sounds like an impossible combination between all qualities from all movies? Perhaps, and that is why I give it 10!Not to mention the sensantional dialog between Mr. Christopher Walken and Mr. Dennis Hopper....

Review title: The Worst Movie I Have Ever Seen.
Review_body: Plot Spoiler: This movie is terrible.There is no doubt in my mind that the reason Tarantino didn't direct this himself is because he is smart enough to see how sophomoric it is. It has all the gore, noise, dirty characters, "hip" dialogue and star-studded cast of his other films except it is missing one key element... artistry.Pulp Fiction and Reservoir Dogs: I will defend forever the necessity of violence in those movies. I am a big fan of Tarantino's directing, storytelling and interesting characters; this film has none of it. Because it wasn't directed by Tarentino, it has no taste. The movie treats its characters with as much care and interest as an injured wolf gnawing its own leg off. The script and direction treat the characters as obstacles to the action sequences (which there aren't many of).The violence usually associated with Tarantino (and his immediate influences like Peckinpah and Scorsese) appears for reasons unknown to Tony Scott. Violence is a way of life for the Wild Bunch or Nicky Santoro of Casino. The directors gracefully and lovingly examine the characters and foreshadow their downfall. We are not supposed to really like the characters, we are supposed to be entertained by them and enjoy their confusion amongst the terrible, dark situations they are thrown into. Here, Christian Slater plays the role as if it were Kuffs 2. He walks through the entire movie with a smirk on his face because he knows the ending of the movie and the size of his paycheck.This is not a Tarantino movie. Tarantino sold the script to fund Reservoir Dogs. True Romance has the feel of a Tarantino rip-off, but instead it is basically a rip off of everything he ever saw in that famed movie store he worked at. It is interesting for true fans of Tarantino to watch this movie and see him evolve from 'wannabe-tough guy movie maker', like Tony Scott, to his unique style of film for which he is famous.PLOT SPOILERSThe plot itself is completely unbelievable and so over the top that you want to take a shower in spring water and watch Beauty and the Beast. This movie is the epitome of "glorified violence." Everybody in the film has to be a bigger badass than they were five minutes before. Watch the scene between Oldman and Slater or Hopper and Walken. Both those scenes are such crap that you wish Scott hadn't even bothered with plot. Basically he wanted to show how cool his characters can be. Those two scenes ruin the movie, no I take that back, it's a terrible movie, those two scenes emphasize how terrible it is. It is based on glamor and attitude, like a Britney Sears video, and has no basis in character development at all.The beauty of Tarantino's real films is the weakness of each of his characters (the gold watch, Jules' enlightenment, Mr. White's compassion, Mr. Blonde's sadism). The only character here that has any flaw is the character played by Bronson Pinchot. That character was created for comic relief, not out of an interest for his flaws and morals (or lack thereof). Not one action made by any character in the movie makes any sense. Alabama falling in love with Clarence after she is paid to have sex with him, Clarence deciding to go kill Drexl and his gang just because Drexl kicked one of Alabama's friends in the stomach, Clarence's dad suddenly becoming so badassed and hard-edged that he p***es off the one-dimensional Walken character... The only reason people think that scene is any good is because they recognize Hopper from his earlier roles in life, they obviously overlook how ludicrous it really is.Every action scene has our two heroes living, despite the odds. The scene where Alabama is beaten in the bathroom quite possibly is the most pointless, mind-numbing five minutes of film ever, especially because she lives. Give me a break! If the scene illustrated how terrifyingly she was murdered then maybe I could stand to sit through it. Why does a comic book salesman think he can escort his new girlfriend through a drug deal? It's not interesting in the least. It's stupid! The whole movie revolves around the idiocy of the audience. It depends on the viewer to become stupider with each scene to understand the ending. How the hell do they survive? That's not interesting! It's stupid! Nothing about this movie is any good.There is not much else to say, the movie is so unrealistic and so unbelievable that each scene makes less sense than the one before it and the audience quickly runs out of forgiveness.I was going to give this movie a 1 but then I remembered Brad Pitt's cameo and decided to give it a 2 out of respect for THAT actor and the only role in this movie that was believable. I lost a lot of respect for Oldman, Hopper, and Walken.*After reading the reviews to this film by users of IMDb.com I realized that nobody has seen any good movies. If I hear one more comment about the scene between Walken and Hopper I will buy the rights to this movie and burn every copy of it. Do yourselves a favor, rent a lot more Howard Hawk, John Ford, Sam Peckinpah, Martin Scorsese, and Sean Penn. They make great films. Tony Scott doesn't. Tarantino is not as original as you all think. I almost want to say I am not a Tarantino fan strictly on the basis of how simple-minded 90% of his viewers are.
One of the GREATEST movies of all time...but then again pretty much everything Tarantino touches turns into gold lol...Top notch cast as well...Tony Scott's top movie in my opinion

It's entertaining, fun, and rewatchable. Although I don't think it's as 'good' or as 'funny' as films like Pulp Fiction and Fight Club, I still seem to wind up watching this film more. Like those films, it has a mixture of light fun and wit, and much darker and harder to watch scenes. Almost all of the 'big name extra' type characters are excellent, especially Pitt, Hopper and Walken, it's just a pity that individually none of them had much screen time. It's not meant to be believable, so don't slam it just because you find it unrealistic or something...it's Tarantino and Tony Scott, live with it. If you enjoy it anything like as much as I do, you'll love it.

This is probably the greatest movie I've ever watched and I've seen a LOT of movies!!! I am not a film reviewer, but felt compelled to review this one... also this film has a bit of an Elvis/Kungfu theme and I HATE Elvis and kungfu, which is even more of a testament to this film! Quentin Tarrentino at his finest, we all loved pulp fiction, but in my opinion this film is far greater!!!! The casting is phenomenal, the acting is superior and the music just blows me away! When the film kicks in Patricia Arquette is narrating the intro and it's like poetry! This film will move you! This film has everything! It's funny, sad, dramatic, dark, twisted and clever I gave this move 10/10, my favourite film being the Godfather it should definitely be up there in the top 100 IMDb films! The Dennis hopper / Christopher walken part is a real treat the scripting and acting is out of this world, in fact there is something likable about all the characters in this movie I don't know how Tarrantino does it!!

There are so many awesome scenes in this movie
The one with Christopher Walken and Dennis Hopper. Dennis calls Christopher a wop.The scene where Christian goes to get her stuff from her pimp and he says "Today ain't white boy day." Oh my goodness I can go on and on and on.But hands down favorite scene is when Alabama and James Gandolfini fight. She takes it like a champ, even laughs in his face!! Then lights him up with hairspray... Oh I love this movie.

A definite future classic, the acting is great, features many before they were stars roles for actors like Tony Soprano James Gandolfini, Tom Sizemore and Samuel L. Jackson.  The scene between Christopher Walken and Dennis Hopper is legendary, and the acting of Gary Oldman is nothing short of spectacular, that combined with the two main characters Christian Slater and Patricia Arquette combines for an instant classic.

Review title: Simply one of the top 20 films ever made. Buy this one!!
Review_body: Why this film isn't in the top 250 is a mystery.  Back in 1993 do you think they knew what they had with all of those great actors?  A masterpeice.  I can't say enough.  If you haven't seen, buy it!  You won't be disappointed. Everything just clicks from the writing to the acting, to the camera work.

Truly a wonderful movie and probably Christian Slater's best performance. Some may argue with me on this one (that would be your Pulp Fiction die hard fans), but I also believe that it is Quentin Tarantino's best script ever. A deranged love story surrounded by impossible odds. Using street smarts, sometimes, our hero "Clarence Worley" played by Christian Slater, mostly trips and falls out of the way of bad situations. You can see the train wreck coming as the calamity of errors start brewing from the very beginning to it's climatic end. The cameo roles play by Dennis Hopper and Christopher Walken are too good to be missed. I have watched this movie a few times looking for the holes and haven't been able to find even one.

There are so many reasons why this is my favorite move ever that I can't list them all, but I'll list a few.1. You may not believe it, but this is a love story, pure and simple 2. The dialog is the best I've ever heard 3. The cast is the best I've ever seen 4. The locations are perfect 5. The soundtrack is amazingI go through periods in life when it is difficult to watch this movie because it reminds me of times in my life when I've watched it with friends that are no longer here, but it is never too far from my mind. I can't really put into words how much I love this movie.Just watch it and enjoy it.

Review title: Dont hesitate to buy this movie without seeing it first
Review_body: If you have not seen this movie yet, run to the nearest video store and rent it, as a matter of fact run to the store and buy it. I guarantee that you will absoulutly love this romance/action. Gary oldman plays drexl, a cocaine dealer that has nothing to lose, christian slater and patricia arquette a dynamic duo, and christopher walken a mobster bad as*. I own this film and it is not an exaggeration that everytime i watch it i get goosebumps.I will not tell you anymore.just please......watch it, over and over again.
Loved It. Would recommend everybody to watch it. So many action scenes takes place.

Review title: Tarantino's best script, one of the best casts ever
Review_body: Go to the main details page for this film. Then look at the cast. Have you ever seen a better group of actors in one place? I know Christian Slater doesn't have a rep as a great actor, but in this film he is. He stands out above everyone else, and that is high praise indeed when you're comparing him to the likes of Christopher Walken and Dennis Hopper. Actually, speaking of Hopper and Walken, they share one scene together, and it is one of the best I have ever scene. I say this with no exaggeration. It's impossible to look away from. The film is worth watching just for this scene.Christian Slater's character is cool. He works in a comic-book store, has a fixation with Elvis Presley, and on his birthday every year he goes to the cinema alone to watch a Martial Arts Triple Bill. Not exactly a standard definition of cool. But he is. He's the sort of character you'd like to be. I can't work out why though, but he's great.I'm not sure what else I can say about this film. I try to be a harsh marker of films, so I only give films that I think are literally perfect 10/10. Which means that only Shawshank Redemption, the Usual Suspects and Return of the King are rated as a 10 by me. But honestly, this film is as good as any of them*. You have to see this movie.*Except for the Shawshank Redemption. That film deserves about 17/10. Unfortunately that might make the universe implode through some paradox or other.

Review title: boy meets girl with a pinch of salt
Review_body: this should be renamed truly superb. great idea, great cast, great music, great shots. the real strong point of this film is the music composed by hans zimmer. in terms of music composers zimmer is in a league of his own. the storyline is very typical of Tarantino with all the crime plot and gorey scenes you need. one thing that tony scott does a lot is use tilted camera angles when someone is lying on the floor. this works very well. the most famous cast members are all really in cameo roles. christopher walken only appears in one scene (a great scene with dennis hopper) and you never see val kilmar's face. gary oldman and brad pitt don't play big roles in fact brad pitt's character (a complete stoner) isn't very relevent to the story. there is only one thing that lets this film down. sometimes Christian slater talks to quietly and quickly for you to understand whats going on. other than that this is arguably better than pulp fiction.

Review title: This movie is in my top 10 favorites
Review_body: Tony Scott did an great job directing this fine film, But all credit must go to Quentin Tarantino he wrote one heck of a script. I know this was one of Tarantino's first scripts, but it could be one of his best. I can understand that at the time Tarantino didn't have enough to budget or get this film off the ground. He did a good move in giving the script to Scott. Scott knows what to do when it comes to movies and i know he let Tarantino make the movie almost like a partner. All of the characters were well thought up and deep. Walken has a great role as does Hopper. Drexel could be one of the best villains of all time. This is one of the 3 movies that all tie in to each other in Quentin's mind. This, Resevoir Dogs, and Pulp Fiction are all connected. With Vincent and Vic being brothers and Mr. White and Alabama being lovers/partners in crime this shows yet another way Quentin is one hell of a script writer. I know the ending is not as Quentin dreamed up, but there is a good viewing of his ending in the Directors cut of this movie. The movie has everything you want. Thrills, Kills, and blood Spills. The movie is also a love story in a true Quentin T. fashion. This movie is probably my favorite movie of all time. its a 10 of 10.

It looks like vomit, it smells like vomit, but it isn't vomit. What is it? Try "True Romance", cinematic piece of puke. 10 Eat, 20 Chew, 30 Digest, 40 Vomit, 50 GOTO 10. Someone mentioning all those actors? Not for a single moment I saw characters they're playing, only obnoxiuos Slater, slutty Arquette, bogus Brad and all those wash-ups. This is NOT Pulp Fiction. Only Hopper is left unscathed by director's wielding shotgun. Maybe that's because he seems only normal person in this movie. Say WHAT?! Movie where Dennis Hopper is the sanest person!? Just watch and look how screen melts from far-over-the-top acting. If someone thinks that's suppose to be cool and I didn't get the joke, well I'm glad I didn't. Just like I'm glad I don't "dig" Rocky and Rambo movies. My cat's hairball is more artistic than True Romance. YUCK!

I consider myself an average movie fan. My DVD collection is modest, about 125 titles, but nothing compared to the thousands that my friends have. I'd rather watch the news or a documentary than a fictitious film, so I was skeptical when a friend from work recommended this movie and told me that it was one of the greatest of all time. I ventured to the video store that night and, with reservations, found the movie on the shelf and checked it out. Fast forward three hours...This movie is perfect in every aspect. It has great directing, excellent casting, magnificent dialogue, great music, the whole package. Every actor does a superb job in their role and you feel like you really get to know the main characters. This is by far the best Tarantino movie of all. I'm not sure why this movie is not in the IMDb "Top 250", I guess its because it is relatively unknown.I beg you, please see this movie. You will absolutely not be let down. I have recommended this movie to many friends and family members and, so far, I've not had one person say that they were disappointed. This is not "Reservior Dogs" or "Pulp Fiction", its a modern love story (not a sappy, tear-jerker), mixed with hard-core action, and gangsters.Prior to seeing this movie I always said that "Lonesome Dove" and "The Godfather" tied for my favorite movie of all time.... However, after seeing this film, it is now a three-way split.

Review title: I am so mad at this movie and at my boyfriend
Review_body: This is the stupidest movie I've watched in years. I even got angry at my boyfriend for recommending it.

They don't come much more entertaining and enthralling than this early '90's classic. Even though this is very much a Tony Scott film (and one of his very best for that matter), ample credit must be paid to our man Tarantino for putting this wonderful, crazy ride together. His dialogue pulsates with wit and verve, his characters radiate with charisma and manic energy, and the whole film is a colorful, rich, endlessly engaging romp. And we can't forget the dynamite cast, who are all at the top of their game here. The Walken/Hopper Sicilian scene is truly one for the ages, and the chemistry between Slater and Arquette is fiery.It's just a shame that the film wasn't more appreciated and lauded upon its initial release but it has rightfully found a cult following in the years to come.

Review title: My favourite film of all time
Review_body: I know this is the most unhelpful review but if you can take anything from my single-minded judgement, Its my one and only cast of the die. Beat it, I dare you...
Absolutely bloody amazing, 10/10 would recommend to friends and family

Review title: The closest thing to Pulp Fiction.
Review_body: This movie is definitely the classiest Tarantino movie behind Pulp Fiction. As all of his movies, the cast reads as who is who of acting talent. It never ceases to amaze me how Tarantino brings out the best in actors, reviving a few careers along  the way. Christian Slater and Patricia Arquette define  the word cool just by being themselves. The film revels in its own environment, the world it creates, and those who will like it will absolutley love it. There's a lot of violence, yet the violence is the most interesting and meaningful it can be.

true romance is a master piece,a lot of people say that a film should give them good entertainment and pleasure, true romance do not only this but gives you a new aspect of life gives you the opportunity to watch on this world from another side. needless to speak about the guinness act of christian slater that gives a brilliant performance and so real i could imagine i almost know this character clarnce. patricia arket is foxy and would get higher in the films

Review title: Tarantino's best story. It would be worth it just for seeing the eggplant scene
Review_body: One of my all-time favorites. Great mix of romantic-criminal movie. Christina Slater and P.Arquette do a good job, but Dennis Hopper is superb in the scene with C. Walken. The eggplant dialogue is in my opinion one of the best movie quotes ever. It also has some really good violence scenes in wich the action look very real (if you like that like i do, it's your movie). Much better than Pulp Fiction

Review title: The most likeable movie ever made
Review_body: True Romance is a sheer pleasure to watch. It's fast, funny, very very cool, has wicked music, great acting from one of the most talented casts ever ensembled and is a modern classic. I reckon i have watched this movie around 10 times and love it more everytime i watch, the ending is a bit cliched but the rest is as original as every other movie Tarintino has written. Trust me watch it, you'll love it.

There are opponents and proponents to this amazing film, with myself being the latter.  Not only is it one of the top ten films of all time, it's the best film of the 90's -- without fail.Tarantino and Scott have something special here.  They have a film you can watch over and over and get something new out of every time.  They have a film that has one of the greatest casts ever put together, albeit most have very very small roles.  But each adds something to this amazing production. I'm not going to spoil it by telling you what happens.  See it for yourself, there's no way you won't like it.

Slater and Arquette perform & interact superbly in a fast paced but cleverly written film, for which a little concentration will present a fantastic film. Rather than concentrate on constant action, Tarantino (writer) & Scott (director) chose to dictate the pace of the film with an intricate script, allowing only the climax points to be portrayed with action sequences Scott can forever be proud of. The all-star cast includes Walken, who adds his typically mind-blowing role to the film. As the tagline suggests, stealing, cheating, killing, & romance; four ingredients to a truly great film. Quite simply one of the best- 9.

I really thought this was an excellent film. I thought it was good how it was a love story with a twist, but what a love story, they would do anything for each other. A cast of fine actors with the supporting cast including Christopher Walken and Gary Oldman performing as well as Slater and Arquette. It is the scenes which include their characters which really make the film so good, I thought the Drexell scene was very funny. The Tarantino influence is obvious and it would have possibly been even better directed by him. There was less violence than I expected but this was necessary to understand the characters such as the Arquette/Gandolfini scene. This is definitely a film I will watch again and again.

one of the most detailed and well scripted movies of the 90's. slater, and arquette give their best performances ever. the all star cast with brad pitt in only a support roll gives the movie serious legitimacy. a cult movie for those of us who grew up in the 90's.

This 5-star movie rated 7.9 on the IMDb scale. I never viewed this movie until 2009 because I was stuck in Saudi Arabia in 93. I never heard of it until I browsed Tony Scott and saw its rating. In summary, this movie was filmed ahead of it time. It's a 'wild' and 'free' loving movie and a part of pop culture. I fell in love with Clarence and Alabama and their magical attraction to each other. Very few movies with a cast of pop stars turns into a masterpiece. This movie is Tony Scott's 'magnum opus' or greatest work. I purchased a director's cut copy. Tarantino wrote a pop culture classic. Scott directed a love story like no other. Slater, a comic book salesman and movie enthusiast, played the part of a delusional 'King of pop'. Arquette, loyal hot pants, to pimp and then husband was alluring. Hopper was Hopper, a trustworthy father who passed his freedom loving genes to his son Clarence. Kilmer played Elvis in voice as the 'King of Pop' to a mentor driven Clarence. Walken has never been better as he played a Sicilian mobster after his cocaine deal went bad. Oldman played Oldman as the pimp, drug pusher, pirate of Detroit. Pitt played a minor part made major by his drug habits. Without major credit, James Gandolfini played Tony Saprano in the making. I'm sure his unbelievable performance led to him being selected for the HBO series "The Sopranos." In a nutshell, this sick movie was fantastic and alluring.

The Christopher Walken Dennis Hopper Scene was a 10 best all time scene. Those two great actors had never appeared in a film together before. They worked together again in 1995's SEARCH and DESTROY but there was no way to recapture the magic of TR's pivotal trailer scene. Maybe someday someone will write a movie that has Hopper,Walken,Oldman,Guy Pierce, Christian Bale,Michael Caine,Gene Hackman,and Tommy Lee Jones. Now that would be a cast. Batman Begins did have four of the above. And fans of the film P.C.U. know that Caine and Hackman appeared in A BRIDGE TOO FAR together, creating the basis for a character's doctoral thesis. But I digress. Quentin Tarantino should get his True Romance/Pulp Fiction groove back and use the above suggested cast.

.... utterly contrived,ridiculously implausible and totally brilliant. Simply the best film l have ever seen; from the story, the script, the cast, the acting, the location, to the sound track it is flawless and the definition of cool. The film is considered over estimated by some, but for me it has everything; drama, comedy, tension, action and a love story, and to get caught up in the plot flaws is to lose the point of the tale. I cant add anything that hasn't already been said about the scene between Christopher Walken & Dennis Hopper but if there is a finer scene in any film, l have yet to see it.

Review title: Snowflakes and kittens, warm woolen mittens!
Review_body: I watched this film for the frist time as a 17 year old civil servant. 3 weeks later i was in drama school pretending to be a tree and writing bad plays. The whole thing kinda fizzled out after about five years study, a couple of qualifications and the nagging suspicion that i stank at being artistic. But the begining remained, the joy i felt at knowing that something could be crafted that had the ability to change someones world and the decision to embrace it entirely. True Romance quite simply rocks. The cameos, the monalogues the grrrl power the style and charachters the words and wit. In a quote  " I like this film Clarence. Always have, always will."

Hans Zimmer's score is awful. Like the worst work of his career. It's generic, early 90s, pg-comedy bad. I can only assume it's function is to soothe over the movie execs offended by Tarantino's story. So distracting and deters from the solid soundtrack.

True Romance is quite simply put a classic movie. It is also a movie that endures due to its style and content. Based on Quentin Tarantino's fresh script loosely influenced by Terence Malik's Badlands, referenced by Hans Zimmers similar score for the soundtrack. Directing duties passed on to competent visual action director Tony Scott after the success of Tarantino's debut Reservoir Dogs.To be honest I don't think the film could be in better hands than Tony Scott's... His style, visual flair and balls out frenetic action gives Tarantino's pitch perfect script the care and attention the lover's on the run, action thriller truly deserves. Scott has been quoted as acknowledging True Romance as his favourite piece of work as well as recently screening an anniversary showing of his own personal copy of the masterpiece. I only wish I had been there for that experience.The story ignites with two social misfits Alabama Whitman (Patricia Arquette) & Clarence Worley (Christian Slater) meeting at the movie theatre in Detroit where they quickly begin a whirlwind romance. However, Alabama's past comes into the fray and all hell breaks loose as the couple abscond with a suitcase full of trouble, with the mob and police in hot pursuit resulting in a spectacular orgy of ultra violence and punchy dialogue.The calibre of cast in this movie is outstanding all at the top of their game with some note worthy stand out performances such as newcomer Brad Pitt in a perfectly suited stoner role... Also the classic rivalry scene with the late Dennis Hopper trading Tarantino's dialogue with Christopher Walken is something to behold.
Easily one of the best movies of the last 30 years. The scene with Dennis Hooper and Christopher Walken is both of them at their best.

Review title: A contemporary fairy tale. Love, violence, and a bounty.
Review_body: Why is it that this movie is always classified as nouveau violence? Yes there is violence, and a lot of it but not more than in any run of the mill Hollywood movie. It is also filmed in a way that makes you want to cover your eyes. Hey, violence does that. But it is also a romantic story of two young people that dont care too much for convention or even reality. His world is one of heroes, in comic books and on the big screen. She falls for a John and takes this plunge by telling him everything. Its a fairy tale. No matter how grim things get, there is that happy Hawai tune playing in the background, thats love.

This is one of the greatest movies ever. As usual tarintino turns out a fantastic script and the direction from Tony Scott is sheer brilliance, but the cast, wow, it must be one of the greatest casts ever, even cameo roles are filled by stars. Christian Slater plays Clarence, a low paid comic book store worker living life to the fullest, when he meets call girl Alabama (Patricia Arquette). ironically they fall in love and get married. Clarence goes to sort out her pimp (gary Oldman) and ends up killing him. He finds a suitcase full of cocaine. they flee to L.A to unload it whilst the owners of the coke follow them in an outstanding turn of events. With some of the most memorable scenes in film this is a must see, it would be worth seeing just for the actors in it. Dennis Hopper plays Clarences father and Christopher Walken as the drug dealer in pursuit. With many great performances from James Gandolfini, Micheal Rappaport, Saul Rubinek, Brad Pitt, Tom Sizemore, Chris Penn, Bronson Pinchot, Samuel. L Jackson and Val Kilmer as Elvis. This film promises not to disappoint. Tony Scott has always been known for his way of making a certain topic interesting (Top Gun, Days of thunder, crimson tide) and in this case Love. I was moved by this film, by far one of the most heartwarming films ever made, unusual for a Tarintino script but it is very touching. A phenomenal film and definitely one to buy. 10/10

This movie is driven by a great story , an almost Cinderella like romance surrounded by brutal violence. The musical score is fabulous and the acting terrific. This movie will forever be a cult classic if only because of a scene between Dennis Hopper and Christopher Walken which only Quenten Tarrantino could write...I say no more--- Patricia Arquette is wonderful in this movie with Christian Slater. It is easily their best movies - they look good together in this preposterous wonderful ride ----and there is another classic hilarious scene with Brad Pitt which alone is worth the 'price of admission' You will have no idea as to what will happen next in this movie, a violent comic romantic fantasy ==I'd give the movie a 10 but the movie is only a great movie to see and watch --it is not a serious movie but who needs serious- it's a very big small movie and that's just fine

possibly my favourite film of all time, this truly does live up to its title and presents in my mind one of the truest romances there can ever be, fictional or otherwise. superb acting, superb directing, superb scriptwriting and possibly the best cameo ever by Samuel L Jackson to cap it off. i don't think that this film could be any improved in anyway whatsoever, even if it had an unlimited stream of cash and all actor/actress available. just a truly spectacular piece of film making and the reason why i love movies so much...i have a rule that no one can leave my house unless they watch this film beforehand, it is truly one of the greats and anyone who doesn't watch it is severely missing out

Review title: Should have been filmed by the king: Tarantino
Review_body: The only reason I give this film a nine out of ten is because of the directing. This is Tarantino's story and it should have been his film to direct instead of Tony Scott (not that he's a bad director). My reason for this thought, is that after watching every film Tarantino has created it saddens me that he hasn't fully constructed True Romance. The true Romance cast was perfect and he could have produced some sheer magic with the chosen actors. Also, the music would have been completely different if Tarantino was utterly in charge.Tony Scott was out of his domain filming True Romance. He simply did not display Tarantino's ambiguousness as it should have been. Now you might ask yourself why I gave the film such a high rating. The answer is merely simple. This movie is still awesome disregarding my little problem. It grasped me from beginning to end. The unexpected kept on leaping towards me. I thoroughly enjoyed every part of the film, including the romantic one's (hence the title of the film). This is the core of Tarantino's complicated mind that has brought us so many masterpieces. Tony Scott did do a wonderful job with the complicated story he was given. It is only a shame that this film wasn't Tarantino's directing debut. Any genuine Tarantino fan is required to watch this film!

i didn't see this movie until recently, and it is one of those 90's film that just invokes nostalgia for that time and in many ways captures the essence and style of a period in time. I dont know what it is about quentin taratino but many of the projects he's involved with provoke this response.Even though I know he was unhappy about natural born killers, i love that movie and feel the same way about it, you coould probally say the same for pulp fiction. True Romance is one of the greatest films to come out of the 90s, every scene, every line, every shot! Some movies just do it for you, this is one of those movies for me. If you havent seen this movie watch it with your girlfriend.

Review title: My favorite film of all time.........
Review_body: This film has everything.... and i mean everything. Great actors, great script..... it'll make you laugh and it'll make you cry. It is pure genius. Let's name some of the actors in this film! Christian Slater, Patricia Arquette, Gary Oldman, Dennis Hopper, Val Kilmer, Christopher Walken, Brad Pitt, Samuel L. Jackson..... blah blah blah the list goes on. Now don't get me wrong. A lot of these well known names only have a few minutes on screen but trust me when i say that these few minutes are .... well .... genius. My personal favorite is a scene with Walken and Hopper (i don't want to ruin it, not that i could).... but it is what film was made for. This film has a number of rememberable quotes (and if you can't remember them, you will be learning them to tell your friends)..... honestly, you will. The "theme music" for this movie is also perfect. You are guarantied to recognise it. Hans Zimmer!!!! I friend introduced me to this film and if i have introduced it to you, I hope but secretly know you will introduce it to others. It's simply ..... genius!!!

This film has been my number one for the last 10 years! I can't fault it! It has absolutely everything, from romance, mobsters to even kung fu! I can watch this film again and again! From its superb acting to filmography; it's the type of film I only wish I would work in one day!The character development is amazing and very relatable, being that Clarence is your 'everyday-man'. ALSO not forgetting this amazing soundtrack; it is so unbelievably beautiful and just fits the whole film perfectly! Hands down i'll give this film a 10, for me it is just my favourite, I cant say its the best film I have ever seen but, oh, do I keep coming back!

Review title: I like you Clarence, always have, always will.
Review_body: Simply put, this is the best movie that has ever been made.Christian Slater gives an amazing performance as Clarence, so too does Patricia Arquette as Alabama. Through out the movie, there are epic individual battles between Slater & Gary Oldman. Christopher Walken & Dennis Hopper. The late James Gandolfini(RIP) & Arquette, not to mention the epic finale to this masterpiece. And the awesome short scenes between Slater & Val Kilmer, who plays Slater's imaginary friend, who is none other than the King himself, Elvis Presley. I am giving nothing away as it would be an injustice to anyone that has not seen it, my advice is, go watch this movie immediately. I swear that you will not regret it. Easily the easiest 10 out of 10 there has ever been.

Review title: True Romance - a definitive QT trend-setter....
Review_body: True Romance is an incredible movie; not only are the characters rich, well developed and highly interesting...but there are many subtle parts to the movie that are incorporated in later QT works. The triple feature that Clarence goes to (the Sonny Chiba films; Sonny plays a prominent role in Kill Bill, as Hattori Honso), the Samuel Jackson character (a brief but brilliant sign of things to come in Pulp Fiction), and the way Tarantino includes various cameos and short scenes that seem to lift already popular actors to an even higher plateau are just a few things I love about this film. Did you know that James Gandolfini's scene in the hotel room with Patricia Arquette is the defining scene that secured his being cast as Tony Soprano? Gary Oldman shows how versatile he is by playing a well disguised white pimp with amazing dialogue; the scene between Christopher Walken and Dennis Hopper is (in my opinion) one of the greatest ever filmed. The Director's Cut version of this movie has a slightly different ending to the shootout; subtle, but strangely powerful. I would HIGHLY recommend this film to anyone who enjoys the wacky, brilliant world of Quentin Tarantino.

I definitely enjoyed the movie with all the great acting performances, but thought it dragged on a little during the second hour. The interactions between Walken and Hopper, Slater and Oldman, and Arquette and Gandolfini are all fun to watch. One of the main issues I had was making up my mind about Christian Slater and whether to think of him as a hero or not. Also what happens to Walken? It seems odd that he has his one scene and then only his men are involved throughout the rest of the movie.I went back and forth on whether to give this movie a 6 or 7, but as I think back to the earlier parts of the movie, it's worth it's 7.

Review title: This is really Tarantino's best and I loved his other movies
Review_body: This movie introduces many of today's powerhouse actors and the cast alone is so full of future and current (at the time) stars that it almost can't help but be great. All I will say about the characters is this: watch for Brad Pitt's character, he only has a few minutes, but you won't be disappointed. Also, watch for the scene between Christopher Walken and Dennis Hopper. It may be the best scene in a film that I can remember.The thing that makes it it hard for True Romance to gain the acceptance of other Tarantino's films is that it really is a romance story and most of Tarantino's fans (I assume) are male and are probably not interested and or threatened by watching a "love story". However this is romance Tarantino style with violence and blood galore injected with appropriately timed humor. But like all good movie dramas an attachment to the characters is vital to the emotional impact of the movie and it is the love story in this that makes every gun fight, torture, or death that much more interesting, meaningful, and powerful.If you like other Tarantino movies see this one, you will definitely like it. It is the least known of his movies, his first, and arguably his best

After watching this movie, I immediately felt like watching it again. 
It has a good mix of comedy, drama, action, suspense and of course ROMANCE. 
Christian Slater and Patricia Arquette are both very likeable and sympathetic.
Has a lot of cool cameos from Hollywood A listers and a great performance from James Gandolfini who is as intimidating as ever. Overall give it a watch.

Review title: Perfect scenario paired with terrifying cast and dialogue makes this one of best movies ever made!
Review_body: True Romance is obscure film. Film was unfortunate to come at the time in which huge blockbusters and award winning film were slowly coming to screen, there of it was forgotten. All people to who I recommended this film never heard about it, and when they saw it, they only have one word: SUPERB! Tarantino who decided to split Natural born killers and True Romance scripts (which ere basically same script ) made terrifying job at it, but real star behind film is late Tony Scott. Without a doubt, this is best film Scott has ever made, and that can be seen in whole film, from cast to score and even ending which is best thing that Scott decided to do, despite Tarantino's wishes, but even Tarantino himself was pleased at the end of it. Scott gave himself into the film and created cult masterpiece that will never be forgotten. Cast is terrifying. Cristian Slater before he become second rate actor and Patricia Arquete had believable chemistry on screen which made whole film. Supporting cast including Gary Oldman ( In his best role ever put to screen), Christopher Walken, James Gandolfini, Denis Hopper not to mention others, made beautiful ensemble cast which was not very well known at the time, but today, they are all first class actors. I could write about this film for hours, but in the end I can only say that watch this film and enjoy one of best films ever made. Live fast, die young, be a ice looking corpse!

Review title: When people ask me my favourite movie what do i say? duh!
Review_body: OK i think its impossible to have a favourite anything for all we know something can come along and blow it out of the water and in the case of True Romance it may have already happened in many peoples opinions. Anyhow, i love this movie. I ended up just buying it Willy nilly (for no apparent reason) as the cover looked great on the DVD version and i hadn't heard much about it but i was also impressed by the cast when i checked the back of the case. I just mentioned the cast and they deliver but the whole film feckin delivers! The story, the acting, Dennis Hopper and Christoper Walken together! (drools) even though it was only one scene it was probably one of the best in cinema history. All the actors do the job great portraying Tarantino's rag tag bunch of misfits and Tony Scott does brilliantly in painting Tarantino's picture. You cant beat class!

Written by Tarantino, directed by Scott, composed by Zimmer. This film really is a piece of art and contains nearly every genre in the film industry created to keep viewers at the edge of their seats, as well as to make them feel complete. One of Tarantino's finest scripts, which includes one of his greatest scenes.This film goes from Detroit, to Los Angeles, from Americans, to Sicilians, from love, to crime. True Romance portrays a great storyline, excellent characters, and an amazing soundtrack which can cure any feeling of sadness.Gary Oldman, Christian Slater, Patricia Arquette, and Christopher Walken, without a doubt give their best acting performance in each scene we were blessed to see them in, making each aspect of this film more beautiful, and enjoyable with a satisfactory climax.Despite its 7.9 rating, True Romance is arguably one of the greatest feel-good, and suspenseful movies of its generation, perhaps of all time.

Man, I just watched this movie for the first time and I can honestly say that it managed to instantly become one of my all-time favorites by the moment the credits started rolling.This film is a joyful mixture of gruesome humor, impeccable acting performances from the likes of Gary Oldman, Christopher Walken & Brad Pitt, as well as, unsurprisingly stellar writing from the genius that is Quentin Tarantino."True Romance" is a literate of awesomeness and I strongly encourage you to go grab the DVD, put the disc in and enjoy this movie in its sheer brilliance.
To me, this will always be the quintessential Tarantino/Scott movie. Loved every frame

Review title: A fantastic action romp and a modern day romeo and Juliet
Review_body: TRUE ROMANCE:Director: Tony Scott Cast: Christian Slater, Patricia Arquette, Dennis Hopper, Christopher Walken, Val Kilmer, Gary Oldman, Samuel L. Jackson, Brad Pitt Genre: Action, Thriller Certificate: 18 Released: 1993This criminally under-appreciated cult classic is a true masterpiece that deserves to be watched by everyone! From the ridiculously strong casting to the excellent script (written by none other than Quentin Tarintino), almost everything about this movie is stylish, cool and near perfection.As I fore mentioned above, the cast is full of some of the best actors in the business. Christian Slater is in top form as Clarence, a loser working in a comic store who comes across the opportunity of a life time when he and his newlywed wife, Alabama (Patricia Arquette) come across a suitcase of uncut cocaine. They begin their road trip, setting off to sell the lot to a rich client and living off it for the rest of their lives.All is not as easy at is seems, though. Upon their travel they get tracked down by a gang of Sicilian mobsters (led by Christopher Walken) who were the original owners of the cocaine. What follows is a high octane, super stylish chase full of moments of laughter, breathlessness and shock, including one of the most infamous speeches in cinematic history delivered by Dennis "your grandmother f****d a n*****" Hopper. What should also be noted is the quality of directing. The action comes thick and fast with numerous gunfights breaking up the story including the breathtaking finalé proving an obvious highlight and also the shocking scene where Alabama gets beaten to within an inch of her life by one of the Sicilians mobsters. Moments like this are so brilliantly choreographed that it brings out the deepest of emotions from you.All in all this is a movie that simply must be seen as soon as possible. Please don't deny yourself of the experience of this balls out action flick as it is a modern classic and you'll be hard matched to find anything better for a Friday night in.Rating: *****
Outstanding script by Tarantino, pulpy, kinetic direction by Scott, and a wildly talented ensemble cast create one of the most enjoyable and memorable crime comedies in cinematic history.
Loved it! Tarantino's best script and a great, ensemble cast make this one of the best crime comedies ever made.

Quite possibly one of the greatest crime films from the 90's. What sets this apart from Tarantino's other early work is that it has heart. It still divides it's critics now in the same way it did in 1993. Everyone in the film gives career best or career defining performances. It has some of the best dialogue ever put to film. An unflinching personal crime fantasy. Quite simply amazing.

Review title: Without a doubt,the GREATEST movie of all time.
Review_body: Someone needs to give Billy Hopkins an award for casting this movie.The action was out of control,the dialogue was outstanding, and the romance was true.I have never seen a movie  that I could even compare to True Romance.A must see.Now tell me, am I lying?

Review title: Excellent cast and movie especially Drexyl
Review_body: Gary Oldman was absolutely unbelievable in this movie I didn't even know he was in the movie the first 3 or 4 times I watched this movie.  He actually came across well as a half black and half Cherokee person.  All performances were outstanding with the usual excessive gratuitous violence that I admittedly enjoyed.  One of my favs.

Review title: The best film of this current genre!!!!
Review_body: This film has it all! Tension, humor, violence and excellent performances by the entire cast. Watch for Samuel L. Jackson, Brad Pitt, Gary Oldman and Val Kilmer. Don't miss this film. The best film of the year by far with more memorable sequences that any in recent memory. A wonderful fairytale!

Review title: one of my favorites, but rips off Badlands
Review_body: This is one of the most entertaining movies that I have seen ( the scene between Walken and Hopper is one of my all time favorites.) I also have noticed that it is quite similar to Malick's Badlands: seen in the southern female narration and the calypso-ish music. This doesn't take away from the film, where True Romance is both wickedly violent and amusing to the point of an almost perfect mix.

Some judge that the values the movie transmit are more conservative than counter-cultural or alternative,and that this doesn't prevent it from being a typical Hollywood movie.I think on the contrary that True Romance is quintessentially a Hollywood movie because the values it tries to transmit (the supreme value of the individual against all forms of authority(the police and crime,and on a lighter level,family and traditional moral),life seen as a roller-coaster...)go directly against the traditional American ones.It only serves Hollywood's almost subversive aims to use the pattern of the American Dream,to couple it with the notion of the Hero,and to lend it a woman's voice.

This film has it all violence, humor, love, and even a little heart. Slater was quoted as saying that he was most proud of this film, and rightfully so. His portrayal as Clarence is masterful, and extremely memorable. Words can not give this film justice so i will leave it at that. #1 film all time

This movie proves, once again, that Mr. Tarantino is a great filmwriter. His dialogues are simply magnificent. I've also never seen a film that combines real violence and pure romance in such a touching way as this movie does. The acting was also really good, certainly when you consider that this is, after all, an action movie.  Christian Slater and Patricia Arquette aren't bad, but the real stars are the supporting actors.  Just see the scene with Dennis Hopper and Christopher Walken or the performance of a dreadlocked Gary Oldman, and you will understand what I mean. And then there is the music.  Great music.  Especially the 'exotic Christmassong' that frequently comes back, is used in an excellent way. I've already seen this film three times and it still isn't boring.  And that is a remarkable achievement for an action movie.

GREAT MOVIE! know, my beloved husband presented it to me when we met first time...now i can't live without him;)) i'm not native american so i saw Movie at first time with translation..then i found it on english and got real pleasure again. Slaiter and Arquette are great, Hopper and Walken always get higher points, and i didn't recognize Oldman at first time. blush, it was surprise...so film gave so many  emotions...

Review title: One of the most underrated movies ever!!
Review_body: This is my favorite movie of all time!! Some of the greatest lines in movie history. A Tarantino Gem. So many great actors in this flick. The scene with Dennis Hopper and Christopher Walken is the BEST!!

This film has it all for me , great acting, tough action, fast paced, wonderful dialogue and good story. Does not pull punches and has really viable characters with something happening every moment.  The ultimate test for me is can you watch it again?  Yes Yes yes

This is one of the finest movies ever made. It has action, mystery, AND romance blended together perfectly. This is one of those movies that will make your jaw drop from the beginning and captivate your all too willing attention throughout. The romance isn't corny like in Armageddon..it is the kind of love we all long for in our idealistic youth. I don't collect movies but I bought this (and 3 other videos) just so that I could keep the emotions this film inspired close to me.

Review title: Characters and love not in the usual movie sense
Review_body: I think this is a phenomenal movie that shows that love can come in all shapes, even if it seems different from what we expect in 'movie' love.  A wonderful demonstration of different types of characters and how they can be all intertwined.  I can, and have, watched this movie over and over and recommend it frequently as one of my favorite movies of all time.

Just look at the cast list...what more could you ask for ?  Ok, so they've ALL done some ropey films, but they've all done some GREAT ones. So has the director. Put the BEST performances from these actors into the BEST movie from Tony Scott and possibly Tarantino's BEST script and you get pretty much sheer cinematic joy ! It's in my Top 10. What more can I say. Rent it NOW !

Movies have come and gone, actors have come and gone. What separates True Romance from the rest is the exceptional cast and the timeless storyline that has no equal. This film is the epitome of coincidence meets destiny. The casting is A+, the acting is A++++ and the story rivals anything Shakespeare has written. The story line takes us from the depths of hell to highs that can not be characterized with words. You have not seen love like this (or experienced it) in film ever. "You have me in a vendetta kind of mood" by Christofer Walken statement in the onset of his conversation with Dennis Hopper I can confidently state that this is the greatest "scene" of all time. This movie has never received the accolades it should have. I am 34 years old and love all types of movies (from silent to independent) and this film tops the list. Can't rave enough about it. If you disagree, feel free to comment to the contrary. Otherwise, enjoy the movie. Watch it over and over and love it forever. This is one of the 5 best movies of all time. If you don't think so, you have issues and kiss my a&&.

Review title: very misleading title for great action movie w/ all star cast!
Review_body: What a movie! Solid action/comedy. Watch for Gary Oldman playing a black drug dealer, James Gandolfini as a ruthless hitman, Brad Pitts best performance ever, Patricia Arquette is hot! Watch it and then watch it again. Great scene between Christopher Walken and Dennis Hopper! This movie has it all!

Review_body:
This was such a Stupid film I was Cringing the whole second half.
Man...the only good thing about it I felt was Gary Oldman and that's about it. But he too comes and goes.

The best movie ever. It is the epitome of the perfect movie experience. It Has everything. It was perfectly cast, perfectly acted, perfectly shot, and perfectly told. Its a love story, comedy, and action film that keeps you entertained.

I love this movie and it is one of my all time favorites!! It has an outstanding cast..Look for James Gandolfini in one of his earlier roles. I love the scene with him and Patricia Arquette, although it may be a little unsettling and hard for some people to watch. I also enjoy watching Brad Pitt in this movie. He has a small part in this movie but he does bring humor to his role. Gary Oldman is truly creepy as a pimp and really makes you not like him at all. This is a movie that shows what happens when people meet the right person for them, and that you can forget about your past and become a happier person. ALthough it starts out with less than perfect circumstances it is a feel good film that shows you love is all you need.

Review title: Well Written by Quentin Terantino, full of Thrills, Action and comedic moments!
Review_body: This is by far my very favourite movie of all time the CAST includes half of Hollywoods biggest stars. So here it goes!Released in 1993, True Romance is an American romantic crime film written by Quentin Tarantino and directed by Tony Scott. It revolves around Clarence Worley (Christian Slater) who is a comic book nerd and an obsessive fan of Elvis Presley and Kung-fu movies, and Alabama (Patricia Arquette), a call girl who was hired by Clarence's generous boss as a birthday present. After watching three Sonny Chiba movies together, Alabama confesses her love for him and they get married the very next day. (Can you smell the drama?) To relieve Alabama from the clutches of her pimp, Drexl (Gary Oldman) Clarence kills Drexl and accidently grabs a suitcase of cocaine on his way out thinking it is Alabama's clothing. They both jump in a pink Cadillac bound for Los Angeles with dreams of a better life ahead of them, but the mob is soon after them. Trying to offload the drugs, they tangle with cops, criminals and worst of all, Hollywood producers.True Romance is an energetic roller-coaster, bursting with iconic dialogue and remarkable characters, with stealing, killing, cheating and romance all rolled into one to brew the perfect Tarantino movie. Though the soundtrack isn't that catchy as Pulp Fiction or Reservoir Dogs, You're so cool by Hans Zimmer stays with you. Patricia's commitment to the role is apparent with changing and demanding effort to play the character of Alabama in totally contrasting situations. Every character has individualized personalities making a lasting impact on the viewers. There's also a tint of magic realism with Clarence receiving visitations from a figure who can only be interpreted as ghost of Elvis - who convinces him to risk everything for Alabama. There's a gazillion references to pop culture for this generation to know about. If you are a Tarantino fan, you must watch it. If you are not a Tarantino fan yet, watch True Romance to become one.

Review title: my favorite movie of all time....so far..
Review_body: this is the most beautifully written love story i have ever come across. although at times it is unbelievable, it only adds to the intense emotion between Clarence and Alabama. what more could you ask for?...sex, drugs, violence, Elvis, the search for a better life and all the unknown yet somewhat expected drama that comes with it...i love everything about this movie. i realize that it is somewhat of a retaliation upon natural born killers, which i also LOVE, so i think that if Tarantino writes something that he wants done a certain way, he should direct his love story films just as he does his action films and then maybe he will be happy. if not, he should stop whining about all the money he makes from having other directors adapt his films and do them the "wrong" way. anyway, true romance is my favorite movie. so there.

Review title: Reservoir Dogs-GOOD Pulp Fiction-GREAT True Romance-EXCELLENT
Review_body: This perfect cast takes you on a rollercoaster ride from start to finish. From the small roles of Samuel L Jackson, the then UNKNOWNS Tom Sizemore&James Gandolfini, Dennis Hopper, Christopher Walken, Brad Pitt and Gary Oldman (Kim Basinger received a best supporting  actress award for her tiny role in LA CONFIDENTIAL, so how come Oldman didn't get a supporting actor award  for this film, he was AWESOME)to the main characters, Christian Slater and Patricia Arquette, this movie doesn't miss a single beat. The dialogue is superb, going from hilarious to gutwrenching and vice versa in a split second. This movie has it all, and if it sounds like I am saying it doesn't get any better than "True Romance" than you would be right, it doesn't....

Y'all can't hear me loud enough. I LOVE THIS MOVIE!!! Few films can withstand the test of 50+ viewings. I don't want to take a lot of time or space here, but it means so much to me to read everybody else's reviews of this joint, and to know that so many other people feel the way I do about it. My man, I don't know your name, said: "It's true romance... He kills her pimp, and she takes a Royal beating for him. BUT the movies's not over. You have to have pulled some crazy s*** in your life to totally appreciate this movie, but it is awesome." That's so damn true, it's not funny. If you have a little history of drug dealing, or a little bitty piece of violence in your background, and have ever loved someone else so inherently that you would live and die for that person, you have to be six feet under to not be moved by this movie. Much love to everyone involved in this project, and to all those who ever really felt this movie, I'm buying the first 7 rounds. P.S. Hans Zimmer is a money-whore now, but this is the best score he ever did. It's been borrowed (I know it wasn't original) WAY too many times.

What could have been a classic somehow has an enormous hole punched through its middle.  limp directing and unfortunate casting of the male lead make the overall film a major disappointment.Nonetheless one of the best scenes of movie history takes place between Walken and Hopper,  so sitting through the rest of the dreck becomes somehow worthwhile.

This is one hell of a movie...what can you expect ? First of all,great actors,a brilliant screenplay,written by Quentin,the one and only,and directed by Tony Scott, the master of action and suspense movies...lots of blood,and violence,but not stupid and miss-used...actually rather good and polished,if violence could be described in that way...However, if you are a fan of black-humor and good action with the witty touch,then this is your movie,I strongly recommend this piece-of-art, to everyone and in the end I would like to add that this is one of those movies that not many people know of, so, don't let this fact disappoint you...enjoy,I returned to this movie over and over again. Cheers !

Review title: Some good performances, but overall over-rated and boring.
Review_body: I do not see why this film is so popular. It's kind of disappointing that many people believe this movie is comparable to Reservoir Dogs or Pulp Fiction. The cast is admirable, the acting is good, however the story itself had no appeal to me, at least as it was portrayed by Tony Scott. Christian Slater plays a silly, unbelievable character with a cocky smile on his face throughout the movie. However, good one-scene performances come from Gary Oldman and Dennis Hopper.4/10 - A good cast and acting can't make up for poor directing and content.

Review title: The greatest movie that most people have never seen
Review_body: This is the best Tarantino movie ever Even though it's not a Tarantino movie, well he did write the script, there's so many memorable scenes in this movie it's mind boggling , and the cast !!!!!!!! Christopher Walken , Dennis Hopper , Samuel Jackson , Gary Oldman , James Gandolfini(maybe the best acting he's ever done) , Tom Sizemore, chris penn , brad Pitt etc..........
